intro: Alsophila tarapotensis, commonly known as the Tarapoto hakea, is a fern native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows on rock surfaces or in shaded, moist environments, showcasing its epiphytic nature. Its small, bright green leaves are often covered in a fine layer of hair, which helps in water retention. Alsophila tarapotensis is an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat, contributing to the ecological stability of cloud forest ecosystems.
